intro: Hieracium glumaceum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers that are surrounded by a ring of bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium glumaceum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
